Title: Electronic Signature 21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Signature > eSuperbill
Release Notes:
Post Title: 21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Electronic Signatures > eSuperbill 

Post Description:

With this enhancement in the application the user can perform the 21 CFR Part 11 Complaint Signatures on the eSuperbill. 

Workflow: Patient > Billing > eSuperbill 

The user has navigated to the above mentioned workflow, and clicks on the Sign Button. (Given the “21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Electronic Signature” checkbox is checked in the EHR Settings). The user will be shown the validation popup as displayed in the image below:

 

If the person signing is the same as the one who has created the eSuperbill, the user will be asked to validate this by entering the password with which the user has signed into the application. The username of the user will be displayed in a disabled state in the username field. Upon entering the correct password and clicking on the Verify button. The provider note will be signed.

And the following signature stamp will appear on the eSuperbill.

 


If the person signing an esuperbill is different than the one who has created the esuperbill, in that scenario the text in the electronic signature popup will be different. 

In case the user enters an incorrect password, and clicks on the Verify button the system will prompt the user of an invalid password and stop the user from proceeding with signing.

 

The similar change have been implemented on all the workflows from where an eSuperbill can be signed. 


Also, for all users, even where The "21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Electronic Signature" checkbox is unchecked, upon signing an esuperbill, the system will display the word "Electronically" before signed in the signature stamp.

Title: Change system behavior when CPT DOS Does Not Lie in Its Effective Period (Bulk Charge/Bulk Review)
Release Notes:
Post Title: Restrict/Notify User when Service Date lies outside a Procedure’s Effective Period

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, procedures are considered inactive at real-time if the service date lies outside their effective period. This ensures that users are notified on the spot and rejections of claims can be avoided.
Goes To:

Currently, in our system, a procedure is marked active/inactive with an “Active” checkbox in the procedure settings, which is wrong. A procedure’s effective period is provided by AMA/CMS. In this story, a procedure’s active/inactive validation is set to its effective period. Meaning, if a procedure’s date of service lies outside its effective period, it is inactive for that date of service.

The user navigates to Bulk Charge/Bulk Review. He/she manually type in a procedure code. If the Date of Service on bulk charge or bulk review does not lie in the effective period of that code, the system will consider it inactive/invalid and give an error message in red. Moreover, the system will also turn the code color to red, and hovering over the procedure code will give the message. Also, the user will not be able to save the bulk charge/bulk review.

Title: Electronic Signature 21 CFR Part 11 - Logging via URL and CureCam > eSuperbill
Release Notes:
Post Title: 21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Electronic Signatures

Post Description:

21 CFR Part 11 is a regulation that sets standards for electronic records and electronic signatures in the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulated industries, including healthcare. It is important for an Electronic Health Record (EHR) because it provides guidelines for the secure and reliable use of electronic records and signatures in the healthcare industry, and helps to ensure that electronic records and signatures are trustworthy, reliable, and equivalent to paper records. This new feature provides enhanced security and compliance for users who are required to comply with these regulations.

 

Workflow: Settings > Practice > My Practice Settings > EHR

To ensure that only those who wish to use this functionality can do so, we have added an option to turn on the permission for electronic signatures in the EHR Settings. By navigating to the above-mentioned workflow, under the General Section, a checkbox by the name of “21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Electronic Signature” has been placed. By default this checkbox is unchecked. If this checkbox is checked. Once the user goes to any workflow to do an electronic signature, as per the standards the user’s would have to follow them in order to perform an electronic signature.



Once the above checkbox is checked, and the user navigates to the below mentioned workflows. The system will display the Electronic Signature validation pop up to validate the user before the user can electronically sign.

Workflow: Patient > Provider Notes

The user has navigated to the above mentioned workflow, and clicks on the Sign Button. (Given the “21 CFR Part 11 Compliant Electronic Signature” checkbox is checked in the EHR Settings). The user will be shown the validation popup as displayed in the image below:

 If the person signing is the same as the one who has created the provider note, the user will be asked to validate this by entering the password with which the user has signed into the application. The username of the user will be displayed in a disabled state in the username field. Upon entering the correct password and clicking on the Verify button. The provider note will be signed.

And the following signature stamp will appear on the provider note and the relevant reports.

 

Below is an example, once the user signs a radiology order. The updated stamp appears on the radiology order report. 

 

If the person signing a note is different than the one who has created the note, in that scenario the text in the electronic signature popup will be different. Below is an example, when the user clicks on the Sign button on the clinical letters popup, and the user signing the letter is different from the one who has created the letter.

 

 
In case the user enters an incorrect password, and clicks on the Verify button the system will prompt the user of an invalid password and stop the user from proceeding with signing.
 
The similar change has been implemented on the following areas:
Lab > Orders
Procedure > Orders
Radiology > Orders
Flow sheets
Memos
Phone encounters
Provider Notes

Note: The username and password that the user provides during the login process will be used to verify their identity and grant access to sign order(s)/notes, regardless of whether they choose to log in via CureCam or DirectURL.

Title: Ability to manually invoke TextToPay Service
Release Notes:
Post Title: Ability to manually invoke Text To Pay Service

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, users now manually invoke the Text To Pay service.
This ensures that the biller also has control over sending Text To Pay messages to patients.

Goes To:

The user navigates to Patient Statements. There, two buttons are available if the location and practice are registered with Text To Pay (practice levels are all applicable). 
When the user clicks on Send Text To Pay button, all the patients available in the search result will be segregated into 2 lists/tabs. 
One tab will contain Patients whom TextToPay can be sent. 


Clicking on Send button will trigger Global Pay to invoke Texts for all the Patients in the list of "Patients with TextToPay."

Other tab contains the list of Patients to whom TextToPay can not be sent, along with the reason why Text can not be sent to them.

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, Practice user can restrict the support user to post payment against specific payment method. Title: Ability to search based on Preferred Language and Age in Months on Patient Search Report
Release Notes:
Post Title: Ability to search based on Preferred Language and Age in Months on Patient Search Report

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, users have additional search options of Preferred Language and Age in Months on Patient Search Report. This ensures that patients below the age of one year can be filtered out. Secondly, it also makes it possible to filter out patients by their preferred language as well.

Goes To:


The user navigates to Reports > Patient > Search.

User inputs language in the multi-select search text field of "Preferred Language" similar to that of "Race."


When the user clicks search, those patients will be filtered out which have the input preferred language in the patient demographics.

Secondly, the user selects Months in the radio button with "Age" range fields. User inputs the age in months he/she wants to filter out and the results will be filtered according to the range.



By default, radio button is set to "Years" and functions as per current functionality.

Title: Exclude Patients with PR-100 Adjustments from Patient Statements
Release Notes:
Post Title: Ability to Exclude Patients with PR-100 Adjustments from Patient Statements

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, filters are added to exclude patients with PR-100 Adjustments from patient statements. This ensures that payments can be received from patients who have open patient balances other than PR-100 adjustments as well.

Goes To:

The user navigates to Reports > Patient > Statements.

  1. User checks both the “PR-100” and “All Others” adjustment checkboxes.

    In this case, a    ll patients with PR-100 and all Other adjustments will be included in the search results.

  2. User unchecks “PR-100” and checks the “All Others” adjustment checkboxes.

    In this case, patients with PR-100 adjustments will be excluded while patients with All Other adjustments will be included in the search results. If a patient is with PR-100 adjustments and also with some Other adjustments, that patient will also be excluded.

  3. User checks “PR-100” and unchecks the “All Others” adjustment checkboxes.

    In this case, only patients with PR-100 adjustments will be included while patients with All Other adjustments will be excluded from the search results.

  4. User checks both the “PR-100” and “All Others” adjustment checkboxes.

    In this case, all patients with PR-100 and All Other adjustments will be excluded from the search results.

Title: [Enhancement] As a Provider, I want to be able to view if a Patient qualifies for a MIPS CQM but their documentation for the measure is not complete so that I can complete the documentation and get a better Quality Performance Score
Release Notes:
Displaying Incomplete Measures with Multiple Strata

GIVEN: Quality Programs module is enabled for the practice.

AND: Entities for the current performance year exist in the Quality Programs module.

AND: Patient's documentation is incomplete for multiple strata of a measure

WHEN: User navigates to the patient profile

THEN: System shall display the 'Quality Programs' node in the left tree menu. 

AND: User clicks the 'Quality Programs' node

AND: System shall display a notification icon next to 'MIPS - Registry' showing the count of quality measures with incomplete documentation.

AND: The user clicks 'MIPS - Registry'

THEN: The system displays the multiple strata of measure for which the patient has incomplete documentation as in attachment [Image1.png]


Rules: 

If the patient has incomplete documentation for one stratum of a measure with multiple strata, follow the format, 'Stratum: Stratum Name'. See MIPS 226 in the attachment [Image3.png].

If the patient has incomplete documentation for multiple strata of a measure, then follow the format, 'Strata: Stratum Name 1, Stratum Name 2'. See MIPS 226 in the attachment [Image1.png].

If the patient has completed documentation for one stratum of a measure but still has documentation incomplete for multiple stratum of the same measure, then display tooltip as in attachment [Image3.png].

If the patient has completed documentation for multiple strata of a measure but still has documentation incomplete for a stratum of the same measure, then display tooltip as in attachment [Image2.png].

When the patient has incomplete documentation for multiple strata of measure, show the count for this measure as 1 in the left tree menu. Do not decrement the count for this measure, until the documentation has been completed for all the strata.

Title: Default Provider on Quick Esuperbill
Release Notes:
Post Title: Default Provider unselected on Quick eSuperbill

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, the rendering provider on quick eSuperbill is set to empty by default if no rendering provider is selected on Patient Demographics. This ensures that a correct provider is selected every time a quick eSuperbill is created.

Goes To: https://curewiki.curemd.com/homepage/patient/quick-esuperbill/

 

The user creates a quick eSuperbill.

If a rendering provider is selected in patient demographics, that rendering provider is populated by default on eSuperbill. 
However, if no rendering provider is selected on Patient demographics or the rendering provider selected on Patient demographics is inactive, then the rendering provider on quick eSuperbill will be empty by default. 
(Currently, in this case, system selects the top one on the drop-down list. This behavior of the system is changed.)


In any case, if no rendering provider is selected on eSuperbill, then upon saving system will give a prompt.


This change in behavior is for when Quick eSuperbill is being created. The rest of the population rules are not being changed.

Title: As an analyst, I want the changes made to patient's qualification in MIPS CQMs from patient chart to be reflected on the MIPS dashboard so that both the workflows are in sync.
Release Notes:
Post Title: Displaying Changes Made to Patient's Qualification in MIPS CQMs from Patient Chart on the MIPS Dashboard
Post Description: With this enhancement, changes made to the patient's qualification in MIPS CQMs from the patient chart are displayed on the MIPS Dashboard as well. This ensures that both the workflows are in sync and display the same information.

Scenario 1: Displaying changes in Quality tab
GIVEN: The user qualifies a patient for denominator exception, denominator exclusion, performance met, or performance not met of a MIPS CQM from Quality Programs node in the patient profile
AND: The user navigates to the Quality tab on the MIPS dashboard
THEN: The system updates the points, qualified patients, reporting rate, and performance rate of the relevant MIPS CQM on the MIPS dashboard according to the change made from Quality Programs node in the patient profile  [US_357440_1.1.png]
AND: The system updates the eligible population, points, denominator exception, denominator exclusion, performance met, performance not met of the relevant MIPS CQM according to the change made from Quality Programs node in the patient profile [US_357440_1.2.png]

Scenario 2: Displaying changes in the patient list
GIVEN: Scenario 1 has been successfully executed
AND: The user clicks the patient icon
THEN: The system displays the updates in the eligible population, denominator exception, denominator exclusion, performance met, performance not met in the patient list according to the change made from Quality Programs node in the patient profile [US_357440_2.png]

Rule: The updates should also be reflected in the downloaded patient list 

Scenario 3: Displaying changes in the Entity JSON
GIVEN: Scenario 1 has been successfully executed
AND: The user downloads JSON of an entity with Quality category
THEN: The downloaded JSON displays the updated denominator exception, performance met, performance not met, eligible population according to the change made from Quality Programs node in the patient profile [US_357440_3.png]

Rules: 
  • Decrease eligible population by 1 if the patient qualified for denominator exclusion
  • Eligible population will stay the same, increase performance met by 1, if patient qualifies for performance met
  • Eligible population will stay the same, increase performance not met by 1, if patient qualifies for performance not met
  • Eligible population will stay the same, increase denominator exception by 1, if patient qualifies for denominator exception

Title: [Part 1: Backend] As a Provider, I want to be able to view if a Patient qualifies for a MIPS CQM but their documentation for the measure is not complete so that I can complete the documentation and get a better Quality Performance Score
Release Notes:
Post Title: Completing MIPS CQMs Documentation from the Patient Chart
Post Description: With this enhancement, all the incomplete MIPS CQMs for which a patient qualifies can be viewed and completed from the patient chart. Users can easily view and complete all the incomplete MIPS CQMs for a patient from a single workflow.

If the patient qualifies for IP/denominator of one or more CQM based on the clinical component(s) attached to the patient, the system will display the 'Quality Programs' node in the left tree menu. [See Attachment: MIPS_Registry_1.png]. When the user clicks the 'Quality Programs' node, the system will display a notification icon next to 'MIPS - Registry' showing the count of quality measures with incomplete documentation.

When the user clicks on MIPS - Registry, the system will open up the 'MIPS - Registry' tab. For each incomplete CQM the system will display Measure Name, Measure ID, Measure Type, Entity, Stratum, and the Provider Name(s) in the listing.


When the user clicks on an incomplete CQM, the system will display the list of encounters. [See Attachment: MIPS_Registry_2.png]. When the user clicks on 'Complete Now' next to an encounter, the user is navigated to the eSuperbill tab. On the eSuperbill, the user can add the missing components required to complete the CQM documentation. Once the documentation has been completed for a CQM, the measure is removed from the MIPS - Registry tab.

Title: Moving the appointment to OnHold when adding a Comment on a Problem from the Problem List
Release Notes: With this enhancement in CureMD Application, system will move the appointment automatically to on hold bucket while adding comments against pending problem list description. Also, a message "appointment move to onhold" will be shown at top right. Currently, problem list do not move to onhold bucket on adding comments.

Title: [Technical] Removing yearly check for updating CCM Billing Procedure Codes Library
Release Notes:
Note: Please do not publish this release note on CureWiki. This user story was written to remove yearly check from the code for updating CCM Billing Procedures Code library .
As a CureMD user,
I want to have the yearly check removed for updating CCM Billing Procedure Codes Library
so that eSuperbills continue to be generated for care programs

Removing yearly check for updating CCM Billing Procedure Codes Library
GIVEN: Quality Programs has removed the yearly check from their script for updating CCM Billing Procedure Codes Library
THEN: The eSuperbills continue to be generated for the care programs and there is no break when a new year begins

Rule:
If the codes have been updated in the library for a particular year, then keep populating those codes on the eSuperbill for the subsequent years, until an update in the codes is provided.
If an update to the codes is made then, fetch the updated codes on the eSuperbill. 
There should be no break in the generation of eSuperbills.

Title: Bulk Actions on Problem List
Release Notes: With this enhancement in CureMD application. Practice User will able to perform bulk action on problem list listing. User will able to select multiple problem list and will able add same action on all selected problem list. User can add problem description or able to select any suggested action against select problem list.

Title: Oncology Performance Status Assessment Forms in v10
Release Notes:
Post Title: Ability to Record Oncology Performance Status in 10g

Post Description: With this enhancement in the CureMD application, 3 new assessment forms are added under the category of Oncology Performance Status. This ensures that users can now assess and record the performance of oncology patients directly in 10g.

Goes To: https://curewiki.curemd.com/homepage/patient/behavioral-assessment/

 

The user navigates to Patient > Clinical > Assessments > Templates.

Under the category of Oncology performance status, users can see 3 new assessment forms.

  1. ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group)
  2. Karnofsky
  3. Lansky









The user clicks on the hyperlink to fill out the respective form and record the status of cancer patients based on their performance. Once the score is obtained, the user can now add this assessment component on the provider note and can also see overview graphs of the above assessments.

Title: Billing: Expert System's Warning/Error workflow updates on eSuperbill
Release Notes: With this enhancement in CureMD application, user will able to sign the eSuperbill when Expert System --> eSuperbill setting is enable and on eSuperbill their is only warning. When their is only warning on eSuperbill, now user will able to view the continue to sign button. Currently, with this setting user is not able to the view continue to Sign button.

Title: [Part 2: Frontend] As a Provider, I want to be able to view if a Patient qualifies for a MIPS CQM but their documentation for the measure is not complete so that I can complete the documentation and get a better Quality Performance Score
Release Notes:
Post Title: Completing MIPS CQMs Documentation from the Patient Chart
Post Description: With this enhancement, all the incomplete MIPS CQMs for which a patient qualifies can be viewed and completed from the patient chart. Users can easily view and complete all the incomplete MIPS CQMs for a patient from a single workflow.

If the patient qualifies for IP/denominator of one or more CQM based on the clinical component(s) attached to the patient, the system will display the 'Quality Programs' node in the left tree menu. [See Attachment: MIPS_Registry_1.png]. When the user clicks the 'Quality Programs' node, the system will display a notification icon next to 'MIPS - Registry' showing the count of quality measures with incomplete documentation.

When the user clicks on MIPS - Registry, the system will open up the 'MIPS - Registry' tab. For each incomplete CQM the system will display Measure Name, Measure ID, Measure Type, Entity, Stratum, and the Provider Name(s) in the listing.


When the user clicks on an incomplete CQM, the system will display the list of encounters. [See Attachment: MIPS_Registry_2.png]. When the user clicks on 'Complete Now' next to an encounter, the user is navigated to the eSuperbill tab. On the eSuperbill, the user can add the missing components required to complete the CQM documentation. Once the documentation has been completed for a CQM, the measure is removed from the MIPS - Registry tab.
